alert.note: Alert for Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:23AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rogers, western Mayes, northwestern Wagoner and northeastern Tulsa Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 222 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Oologah to 3 miles southeast of Owasso to 4 miles north of Jenks Riverside Airport. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Pryor... Owasso... Pryor Creek... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Oologah... Adair... Foyil... Tulsa International Airport... Sportsmen Acres Community... Taiwah... Tiawah... Turley... Mazie... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 227 and 265. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
